newsitem.title: USA: IVAX files Paxene NDA for Kaposi's Sarcoma.
newsitem.headline: IVAX files Paxene NDA for Kaposi's Sarcoma.

text.p: IVAX Corp said on Tuesday that it has submitted a New Drug Application to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration seeking clearance to market Paxene in the U.S. for the treatment of Kaposi's sarcoma.
IVAX and NaPro BioTherapeutics Inc are strategic partners in the development, manufacture and marketing of paclitaxel in North America, Europe and certain other world markets.
NaPro provides the bulk active drug substance for Paxene.
IVAX is responsible for the clinical development, registration, manufacture of the finished product, and commercialization of Paxene.
Kaposi's sarcoma is a cancer believed to be related to the immunocompromised state that accompanies AIDS.
